title: Heavy showers above 75 mm expected in some areas today
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in the North-Central, Uva, Eastern, Central and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in the Kurunegala, Vavuniya, Mullaitivu and Hambantota districts after 1.00 p.m. today (01), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Asia-Pacific markets fall after Trump modifies tariff rates
byline: Asian shares fell on Friday after the U.S. slapped dozens of trading partners with steep tariffs, while investors anxiously await U.S. jobs data that could make or break the case for a Fed rate cut next month.

title: Donald Trump reduces tariff on Sri Lanka to 20%, New tariffs go into effect from Aug 7
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday reducing tariffs on Sri Lankan goods to 20% from 44% announced in April, the White House said.

title: Seat belts mandatory for expressway bus passengers from Sep. 1?
byline: Effective from today (August 1), it is now mandatory for all passengers travelling in the rear seats of light vehicles on expressways to wear seat belts.

title: Flooding leaves 14 dead, missing in Vietnam’s Dien Bien
byline: Flooding triggered by heavy rain has left at least 14 people dead or missing in Vietnam’s northern province of Dien Bien, state media reported on Friday.

title: Trump ended 6 conflicts, including India-Pak, deserves Nobel Prize: White House official
byline: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said Trump has ended six conflicts, including those between Israel and Iran and India and Pakistan, adding that “it is well past time that Trump should be awarded the Nobel Peace Prize”.

title: Rohitha Abeygunawardena’s son-in-law granted bail
byline: Dhanushka Weerakkody, the son-in-law of Member of Parliament Rohitha Abeygunawardena, has been granted bail after being produced before the Matugama Magistrate’s Court.

title: “Heartily pleased” – MP Harsha thanks all who contributed to US tariff relief
byline: SJB Member of Parliament Dr. Harsha de Silva has welcomed the decision by the United States to reduce the tariff rate on Sri Lankan goods to 20%, describing it as a significant victory for the country’s export sector.

title: Former Minister S.M. Chandrasena granted bail
byline: Former Minister S.M. Chandrasena has been granted bail after being produced before the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court today (01).

title: No Laugfs Gas price revision in August
byline: LAUGFS Gas PLC has confirmed that there will be no price revision for domestic gas cylinder refills in the month of August, 2025.

title: Justin Timberlake reveals Lyme disease diagnosis
byline: US singer Justin Timberlake has revealed he is living with Lyme disease.

title: Sri Lanka should aim for under 15% - Sajith says after US tariff cut
byline: Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa, Sajith Premadasa, has welcomed the recent decision by the United States to reduce the trade tariff imposed on Sri Lankan exports to 20 percent.

title: UNP commends govt for tariff negotiations, seeks details on US trade deal
byline: The United National Party (UNP) has welcomed the recent executive order issued by U.S. President Donald Trump, which further reduces the reciprocal tariff rates on Sri Lankan exports.

title: Sri Lanka to continue trade discussions with US after tariff relief – Finance Secretary
byline: The United States has announced a reduction in the reciprocal tariff rate imposed on goods imported from Sri Lanka, lowering it from 30 percent to 20 percent.

title: World shares retreat after Trump’s order imposing new tariffs on 68 countries and EU
byline: World shares retreated Friday after President Donald Trump issued a new set of import duties that will apply to dozens of countries as of Aug. 7.

title: Piumi Hansamali & Viranjith Thambugala to be indicted for tax evasion
byline: The Inland Revenue Department (IRD) has informed the Colombo Magistrate’s Court that it intends to file a case before the Colombo High Court against well-known model Piumi Hansamali and prominent businessman Viranjith Thambugala, for alleged non-payment of income taxes amounting to over Rs. 400 million.

title: Tuition classes for scholarship exam banned from Aug 6 midnight
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations announced that the conducting of tuition classes, seminars, workshops and such related to the Grade 5 Scholarship Examination is prohibited from midnight on August 06 (Wednesday) until the end of the exam.

title: ‘Loku Patty’ remanded after 90-day detention
byline: The Nugegoda Magistrate’s Court today ordered that the notorious underworld criminal figure known as “Loku Patty”, who is accused over the murder of businessman “Club Wasantha”, be remanded until August 04.

title: Ceylon Chamber commends tariff reduction, urges long-term trade strategy with US
byline: The Ceylon Chamber of Commerce (CCC) has commended the Government of Sri Lanka and the national negotiation team for securing a further reduction in the reciprocal tariff rate imposed by the United States on Sri Lankan exports—from 30% to 20%.

title: Dilith urges regular dialogue after ‘positive progress’ on US tariffs
byline: Sarvajana Balaya leader MP Dilith Jayaweera emphasised the need for Sri Lanka to diversify its export basket and to engage in regular and comprehensive dialogue with trade partners such as the US as a post-crisis management strategy.

title: Heat advisory issued for several areas
byline: The Meteorology Department has issued a Warm Weather Advisory for the North-Central and Eastern provinces, and the Monaragala and Hambantota districts.

title: Sri Lanka’s exporters and apparel sector welcome revised US tariffs
byline: The Exporters’ Association of Sri Lanka and the Joint Apparel Association Forum (JAAF) today welcomed and commended the significant progress achieved in the trade negotiations between Sri Lanka and the United States, which have led to a reduction in tariffs on Sri Lankan exports to the U.S. market—now lowered to 20%.

title: Immediate steps to fill 5,000 police vacancies – Public Security Minister
byline: Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs, Ananda Wijepala, stated that while there are approximately 28,000 vacancies in Sri Lanka Police at present, steps have already been taken to urgently fill 5,000 of those vacancies.
